dcterms:creator: M. Mercat-Bruns
dcterms:description: The Adult Income data set contains 29,825 instances consisting of the values of 14 attributes, 6 numeric and 8 categorical, and categorizes each person as having an income of more or less than $50,000 per year. It is used to study discrimination based on sex and origin.
dcterms:title: Adult Income Data Set

dcterms:description: The German Credit Data Set is often claimed to exhibit origin discrimination in the success of being given credit by a German bank. It is used to compute disparate impact with respect to origin.
dcterms:title: German Credit Data Set

dcterms:creator: W. Dieterich
C. Mendoza
T. Brennan
dcterms:description: The COMPAS Score Data Set consists of 7,214 offenders with personal variables observed over two years. It predicts their level of dangerosity which determines their eligibility for release, while also assessing potential racial discrimination.
dcterms:title: COMPAS Score Data Set
